# unhideWithoutActivation()

**Instance Method**

Restores hidden windows without activating their owner (the receiver).

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func unhideWithoutActivation()
```

## Discussion

When this method begins, it posts an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/willUnhideNotification] to the default notification center. If it completes successfully, it posts an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/didUnhideNotification].

## Related Documentation

- **activate(ignoringOtherApps:)**: Makes the receiver the active app.
- **applicationDidUnhide(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the app is now visible.
- **applicationWillUnhide(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the app is about to become visible.

## Hiding Windows

- **isHidden**: A Boolean value indicating whether the app is hidden.
- **hide(_:)**: Hides all the receiver’s windows, and the next app in line is activated.
- **unhide(_:)**: Restores hidden windows to the screen and makes the receiver active.
